name: iIf
description: A boolean condition or value is passed into the first argument. If the condition is `true` the second argument is evaluated and returned, if `false` the third argument is evaluated and returned.
discouraged:
Use the ternary operator CF9+ instead because it does not evaluate.
Example ternary operator: `( (condition) ? valueIfTrue : valueIfFalse )`

params.name: condition
params.description: A boolean value or an expression that evaluates to a boolean.

params.name: expression1
params.description: A CFML expression that is evaluated dynamically using Evaluate if the condition is `true`.

params.name: expression2
params.description: A CFML expression that is evaluated dynamically using Evaluate if the condition is `false`.

examples.title: Simple iIf Example
examples.code: iIf( server.os.name IS "Bacon", de("Running Bacon OS"), de("Not Running Bacon OS") )

examples.title: Simple Example using Ternary Operator Instead
examples.description: Instead of using iif, you should use the ternary operator CF9+
examples.code: ( (server.os.name IS "Bacon") ? "Running Bacon OS" : "Not Running Bacon OS")
